overview:
John Wainwright co-founded audience segmentation and targeting company Crowd Science with John Martin and Paul Neto. He currently serves as the Crowd Science CTO.

John has a long history of important work for some of Silicon Valleyâ€™s most distinguished companies. He was most recently co-founder and chief architect of Kontiki, a Granite Ventures, Benchmark and MK Capital-funded content delivery company that was acquired by Verisign in 2006. Before that he created MaxScript, a scripting language for AutodeskÊ¼s modeling package, 3dsmax, which Autodesk eventually bought and integrated into the product. And before that, he was the chief architect of Kaleida Labs, an Apple/IBM joint venture formed around Objects In C, an object-oriented programming language system he had written and sold to Apple.

image.attribution: John Wainwright / Crowd Science
